Photo by Unsplash

Hello and Happy New Year! I’m back, or rather should I say, GenesisWP.guide is back for a new and exciting year of Genesis and WordPress goodness.

As most of you know the site took a little bit of a break over Christmas, but the first item on the agenda for 2016 is This Week in Genesis (8 Jan 2016) which includes everything’s that been happening this week and the best of what you may have missed over the festive period including:

  • Genesis 2.2.6 (and WordPress 4.4.1) released,
  • a boatload of new themes,
  • a lot of good stuff going on from Calvin,
  • plus, super secret beta goings on at GenesisWP.guide

Let’s get to it.

Genesis 2.2.6 (and WordPress 4.4.1)

Genesis 2.2.6 has been released.

Usually for these more ‘minor’ maintenance releases, StudioPress doesn’t go into a lot of details about the changes, but this time they did because there’s a bit more going on.

While you’re in there updating to WordPress 4.4.1, go ahead and update to #GenesisWP 2.2.6 too https://t.co/p7mL6DcyiC

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) January 6, 2016

If you’re more of a Genesis user than a developer then there’s nothing to worry about or concern yourself with.

I don’t want to repeat everything here but if you just want the quick details, they are:

  • Updating Schema.org integration in Genesis to recognise individual pieces of content as ‘CreativeWork’ and not ‘blogPosting’ by default. For the latter, Google requires an associated Image and Publisher object, which is not always present and in some cases can cause content to be flagged as ‘spam’ by Google. (You still have the ability to override and markup any type of content (e.g. a custom post type as a ‘blogPosting’ or anything else you prefer).
  • Compatibility with how WordPress 4.4 handles storing meta data for terms.
  • Switching to using a local html5shiv file (which makes HTML5 elements play nicely on older web browsers) instead of pointing to the one hosted by Google Code, which is shutting down.

If you’re interested in the whole story though I encourage you to check out Nathan Rice’s article on Genesis 2.2.6.

Big thanks to Nathan for continuing to do a stellar job driving these releases.

It’s hard to explain just how nervous and apprehensive I am about releasing #GenesisWP updates. I take the process very seriously.

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) January 6, 2016

WordPress 4.4.1 has also been released with some security fixes.

WordPress 4.4.1 Security and Maintenance Release https://t.co/qXMp1A3RdD

— WordPress (@WordPress) January 6, 2016

Themes

GenesisWP.guide might have been sleeping but you theme creators haven’t, over the last week (and the two weeks we’ve been away) some great new premium themes have popped up.

Lindsey Riel launches the Pretty Happy theme over at Pretty Darn Cute.

? New Pretty Happy Theme now available! https://t.co/ahjTy7vzSr #genesiswp #WordPress #webdesign ?

— Lindsey Riel (@lindseyriel) December 23, 2015

Lauren Gaige over at Restored 316 releases a new theme, Savory, aimed at food bloggers.

Introducing Savory: a #genesiswp theme for the food blogger! https://t.co/SCHxn576fy

— Lauren Gaige (@restored316) January 4, 2016

The folks over at ChurchPress launched Exodus, a smart looking new Genesis theme I’ve previewed before in these updates.

ChurchPress: a new theme shop for churches — https://t.co/JCrcwNKaW0 via @pixldesigns #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/7FDwMHFfAq

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) December 28, 2015

Brian Gardner’s latest theme for his personal site is one of my favourites that he’s done. If you’re a fan also you might just want to keep an extra eye on his Twitter account, because you might just find it on GitHub to download soon.

Thinking about putting this theme up on GitHub for y’all to s̶t̶e̶a̶l̶ download for free. https://t.co/ImCnCwfYWv #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) January 6, 2016

Wes over at appfinite launched a new theme, Guru…

The "Guru" Genesis Theme is now available – https://t.co/LNK8ZeJn9q #genesiswp

— Wes Straham (@WesStraham) December 28, 2015

…and has a couple more in the pipeline as well.

We're working on getting a couple Genesis themes completed and released this week. #WordPress #genesiswp

— appfinite (@appfinite) January 5, 2016

And finally, it’s not new (they just published their version 1.6) but in case you missed it, it’s worth checking out the tru Genesis theme by the peeps over at SPYRmedia (h/t Brian Gardner).

We just pushed out v1.6 of our beautifully simple #genesiswp theme, tru https://t.co/aVa2aDpCUB. Look at that, v1.6 on 1.6.15.

— SPYR (@SPYRmedia) January 6, 2016

EDIT (9 Jan 2016)… And one more theme release to add to the round-up, big congrats to Stephanie Hellwig on her first commercial theme release, Sherri.

A flexible #genesiswp #wordpresstheme #blogger #DIY #smallbusiness https://t.co/W6dzreQilF #WooCommerce pic.twitter.com/hM9VxjGxVQ

— Stephanie Hellwig (@stephanehellwig) January 7, 2016

Showcase

New site from the dream team of Emily White and Greg Young, nelsonlg.com

Excited to launch redesign of https://t.co/v3KbzYfcMy. @hbgreg did a fantastic job with the development of this custom #genesiswp theme.

— Emily White (@emwhitedesigns) January 7, 2016

Two great new sites from Thauna over at Bellano Studio, courtneynestor.com

New site launch – https://t.co/g5GPgYeYoy – get back into your skinny jeans & feed your hungry family. #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/zyVAPwZCc7

— Thauna (@BellanoStudio) January 5, 2016

…and fabulousafter40.com

Just launched a redesign for @Fabulousafter40 – so fresh & pretty, check it out. https://t.co/slKWPpfYrj #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/pAq8R58Ot1

— Thauna (@BellanoStudio) January 5, 2016

New site from Rae Hoffman for katyhighgirlsbasketball.com

put my old WP skills to work last month… check out the new @KTGirlsHoops website on #GenesisWP https://t.co/CnglkquTBI cc @bgardner

— Rae Hoffman (@sugarrae) January 8, 2016

Heather Jones shares two great new designs for cupcakemag.com…

Very excited to share my redesign for Cupcake Mag today 🙂 https://t.co/lfKxgW81bs @cupcakeMAG #genesiswp #webdesign pic.twitter.com/XeOf2Ypeqb

— Heather Jones (@vivalaviolette) January 6, 2016

…and thiswaynorth.net

Project Spotlight- 'This Way North', a travel blog https://t.co/kIC7hxPe4a #travel #blog #genesiswp #webdesign pic.twitter.com/iLzP3fQuGK

— Heather Jones (@vivalaviolette) January 5, 2016

Some great work from Stacey Corrin for theoliversmadhouse.co.uk and notthatjaimeoliver.com (using Shay Bock’s Dear theme as the base).

New #genesiswp blog design for @jaimeoliveruk and both of her sites using the Dear child theme by @shaybocks pic.twitter.com/JtTjrWPSes

— Stacey Corrin (@scorrinblog) January 5, 2016

Fantastic new design from Brian Gardner for nosidebar.com

Have you seen our new design courtesy of @bgardner? https://t.co/uSCALAPEjI pic.twitter.com/HaPFKoaqEu

— No Sidebar (@nosidebar) December 31, 2015

Best of the rest

As much I’m tempted to switch the name of this section from ‘Best of the rest’ to ‘Calvin corner’ (and it would be deserved as he’s so prolific right now) it survives as ‘Best of the rest’ for at least one more week.

And what better way than to kick off with Calvin himself who not only is continuing to work on his Genesis starter theme (announcing it will be mobile first)…

So the Starter theme I'm working is officially going to be mobile-first. Sign up here for updates — https://t.co/eOZxgAuyZR #genesiswp

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) January 7, 2016

…but also just launched an archive of Genesis WordPress developers.

This is pretty much turning into the complete archive of #genesiswp developers — https://t.co/bePx3xit2F pic.twitter.com/wtrfN5W7nP

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) January 7, 2016

…oh and you signed up to his new newsletter too, right?

Want something fresh for the New Year? I’m booting up a brand-new newsletter geared for those who build online. https://t.co/4Sgy969wpa

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) January 1, 2016

Bradley Potter’s got some stuff brewing too.

Last night I forked Simple Sidebars into Super Sidebars. Now controls more than just Primary & Secondary sidebars.

— Bradley Potter (@bradleypotter) January 6, 2016

Initial idea with Super Sidebars – widgetize genesis_entry_content in #genesiswp – user selects which sidebar appears per page/post/term

— Bradley Potter (@bradleypotter) January 6, 2016

Neil Gee with a tutorial on how to Add Custom Post Type Navigation Links in Genesis Themes.

Add Custom Post Type Navigation Links in #GenesisWP Themes https://t.co/OGgfoYIHzc

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) January 5, 2016

And, nice work to everyone that got the StudioPress forum down to no unanswered posts recently.

Great job by the #GenesisWP community! No unanswered posts @nutsandbolts @jamiejmitchell – how long can this last? pic.twitter.com/ZgvWHyTOe3

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) December 30, 2015

Secret beta stuff

I’ve hinted at this before and had a few of your email me about it already, but if you’re interested in some super secret, super beta stuff for GenesisWP.guide I’m hoping to work on soon go ahead and signup here.

That’s all for this week, but as ever I can’t cover everything so if you feel like I overlooked something awesome feel free to tag it in the Comments below.

Have a great weekend.
